Design Patterns in R 0.0.3

  • Articles

Use a docker-compose.yml File

Source: R/docker-DockerCompose.R
DockerCompose.Rd

GIVEN a docker-compose.yml, WEHN DockerCompose is instantiated, THEN the resulting object gives access to Docker commands.

Methods

Public methods

  • DockerCompose$new()

  • DockerCompose$get()

  • DockerCompose$start()

  • DockerCompose$stop()

  • DockerCompose$restart()

  • DockerCompose$reset()

  • DockerCompose$browse_url()

Method new()

Initialize a DockerCompose object

Usage

DockerCompose$new(path_docker_compose = "./docker-compose.yml")

Arguments

path_docker_compose

(character) Path to docker-compose file.

Method get()

Get a value from a service

Usage

DockerCompose$get(service, field)

Arguments

service

(character) Service name in docker-compose.yml.

field

(character) Field name in docker-compose.yml.

Examples

\donttest{\dontrun{DockerCompose$new()$get("shinyserver", "ports")}}

Method start()

Create and start containers.

Usage

DockerCompose$start(service = NULL)

Arguments

service

(character) Service name in docker-compose.yml.

Method stop()

Stop containers.

Usage

DockerCompose$stop()

Method restart()

Restart containers.

Usage

DockerCompose$restart(service = NULL)

Arguments

service

(character) Service name in docker-compose.yml.

Method reset()

Stop and remove containers, networks, images and volumes.

Usage

DockerCompose$reset()

Method browse_url()

Load URL into an HTML Browser

Usage

DockerCompose$browse_url(service, slug = "")

Arguments

service

(character) Service name in docker-compose.yml.

slug

(character) URL slug (e.g. shiny-app-name).

Examples


## ------------------------------------------------
## Method `DockerCompose$get`
## ------------------------------------------------

if (FALSE) DockerCompose$new()$get("shinyserver", "ports")
